content.p: PyMotif is a simple implementation of Gibbs sampling for finding local alignments of DNA sequences. I made it for an assignment of the course Algorithms for Genomes. PyMotif is written in Python (hence the name).

Optionally, PyMotif can detect phase shifts as an extra step in the algorithm and a simple heuristic is supported to find better initial motif positions. See the small implementation report (pdf) for more information (also included in the package below).
An example of using PyMotif to find a motif of width 8 for the sequences in the file sequences.fasta with default settings:
content.pre: $ ./pymotif.py -i sequences.fasta -w 8 Motif occurrences in sequences follow Sequence # 1 TACTTTGA (at position 167) Sequence # 2 AACATATT (at position 488) Sequence # 3 AACATACT (at position 117) Sequence # 4 AGGATAGT (at position 127) Sequence # 5 AGCATGGT (at position 163) Sequence # 6 AAGTTAGT (at position 594) Sequence # 7 AACTTAGT (at position 320) Sequence # 8 TGCTTGGT (at position 29) Sequence # 9 AGGTTAGT (at position 265) Sequence #10 AGCGTAGT (at position 45) $
content.p: The README file in the package contains more usage information.
